Helping underdogs find their roar and turn dreams into life.

I see you. You’ve got this idea you believe in, but you’re tired after work (and the rest of it). You want to start but you’re not sure you’ll have what it takes – it’s a big risk, and it’ll take a lot of time, energy and you don’t have a lot to spend on it either.

But still, you’re determined to make it happen – because fuck working for the man for another 30 years. Life should mean something. Let’s win at capitalism together. YAAAY! (er, I mean, roar.)

Monsters aren’t perfect.

They have crooked teeth, lumps, bad habits and no friends. I’m not saying you’re that way, but even if you are, don’t wait to be the perfect you before you get started.

Monsters don’t think, they do. Here’s some truth: you’re not too old/depressed/boring. You just need a little clarity, which is what we’re here for. And with that, you’ll be ready to FUCK THE WORLD UP with your thing (don’t worry, we’ll only eat the bad ones).

If you nail your brand strategy, not only do you have better chance of success, you get exactly the things you need right now: direction and motivation.

About MoNstA

Ali is a crazy monster with 43 years of experience ripping shit up. There is no normal here. Please ask your friends on Linked In if you want normal. I personally find normal highly annoying (not to mention inhibiting).

I promise three things: Truth, monster metaphors when I can think of them, and brand.

My story

(as far as it pertains to MoNstA. Hit me up to swap memoirs any time though).

I learned brandstrat the hard way. It started with half a decade of web and graphic design. I always thought the process was broken and I didn’t know why. I quit. Then one fortuitous day I discovered The Futur and their Core Discovery framework, which helped me realise that design the way it should be is entirely possible.

Conversely I doubled down on my realisation that deisgn without strategy is completely fucked and a waste of money and time. You need strategy first, or at least designers who can do a bit of it. BUT WHO WANTS TO PAY FOR THAT? If you charge for what it’s worth, it’s just too much for a new business on a budget, let alone a single person chasing a pipe dream and explaining their purchases to a very significant other.

Hence, MoNstA was born to offer these crucial services in ways you – someone working their way out of the daily grind – can afford. So we do it differently to the mainstream brand strategy – it’s less hands on: we let you tackle the process yourself, and stand on the sidelines, like a coach. Or a vicious monster.
